topic.title: The Crashing Septic Patient: Vasopressor Choice in Septic Shock
topic.clinical_question: In patients with septic shock requiring vasopressor support, what is the optimal first-line vasopressor and when should additional agents be added?

case_scenario.chief_complaint: Fever and confusion for 2 days, found on floor by family
case_scenario.key_history: Type 2 diabetes, previous UTI requiring hospitalisation 3 months ago. Independent at baseline.
case_scenario.key_exam_findings: Dry mucous membranes, mottled peripheries, prolonged cap refill (5 seconds), diffuse abdominal tenderness, suprapubic tenderness. No obvious source on initial exam.

topic.scope_notes: Progress through resuscitation decisions: fluid resuscitation targets, vasopressor initiation timing, choice of first-line vasopressor, when to add second agent, lactate clearance monitoring. Include discussion of peripheral vs central vasopressor administration. Cover both ED and ICU perspectives.

additional_resources.notes: CENSER trial - early noradrenaline in septic shock
